intro: [WRONG START] Piper coronatibracteatum, commonly known as the crowned bract pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the Piperaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, green, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, fragrant flowers. Its fruit, a small, three-lobed berry, is used in traditional medicine and has a peppery taste. The plant's unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
